intro: Hemitria uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower hemitria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native habitat.
